quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the scheme mentioned in paragraph?

A. Age limit for the scheme is 17.5 to 23 years.

B. An income tax exempted SevaNidhi Package, equal to Rs. 11.71 lakh to be provided on exit.

C. Non-contributory Life Insurance Cover of Rs. 48 lakh to be provided during the engagement period.

D. Up to 25% of each batch of Agniveers will be enrolled in regular cadre of the Armed Forces.
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
Only D
None of the above

quiz.text:

quiz.text: Which among the following is not correct in reference to scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: In order to qualify for sickness benefit Insured Person is required to contribute for 78 days in a contribution period of 6 months.
Medical care also given to retired and permanently disabled insured persons and their spouses on payment of a token annual premium of Rs.200/-.
There is no ceiling on expenditure on treatment of an Insured Person or his family member.

Maternity Benefit for confinement/pregnancy is payable for 26 weeks, extendable by further 1 month on medical advice at rate of full wage subject to contribution for 70 days in preceding 2 Contribution Periods.
Temporary disablement benefit provided from day 1 of entering insurable employment & irrespective of having paid any contribution in case of employment injury.

quiz.text:

A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is correct with respect to scheme described in above passage?
options: Liberalized remittance scheme (LRS) was introduced in India in 2013.
Remittances can be made only in US Dollars.
There are no restrictions on frequency of remittances under LRS.
Scheme is also available to corporates, partnership firms, HUF, Trusts, etc.
Under the scheme, individuals are allowed to remit up to USD 25,000 per financial year for eligible transactions.

quiz.text:

A. Investor who has remitted funds under LRS cannot retain and reinvest income earned from his investments made under Scheme.

B. Permanent Account Number (PAN) mandatory for all transactions under LRS.

C. Remittance for trading in foreign exchange abroad is prohibited.
options: Only A
Only C
A and B
A and C
B and C

quiz.text: With respect to the National Green Hydrogen Mission, which of the following options is incorrect?
options: Mission aims to make India a Global Hub for production, utilization and export of Green Hydrogen and its derivatives.
PHASE I of the mission will be implemented from 2022-23 TO 2025-26.
The financial outlay for the Mission is Rs.15,744 crore.
Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is the Nodal Ministry of the mission.
All are correct.

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are the target/s to be achieved by 2030 under National Green Hydrogen Mission?

A. Development of Green Hydrogen Production capacity of at least 5 MMT per annum

B. Cumulative reduction in fossil fuel imports over Rs. 2 lakh crore

C. Abatement of nearly 50 MMT of annual greenhouse gas emissions
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both A and C
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above Mission?
options: Under the Strategic Interventions for Green Hydrogen Transition Programme (SIGHT), 2 distinct financial incentive mechanisms will be provided.
The Mission will not support pilot projects in emerging end-use sectors and production pathways.
A public-private partnership framework for R&D (Strategic Hydrogen Innovation Partnership – SHIP) will be facilitated under the Mission.
Only 1 and 3
All of the above

Sharing of SC/ST MSEs data with CPSEs to enhance procurement from SC/ST entrepreneurs.
